titleStmt.title: A Christian confession of the late moste noble and mightie prince, Friderich of that name the third, Count Palatine by [ye] Rhein, one of the electours of the holy Empire, and Duke in Bauire: wherein constantlie and meekelie he departed out of this world the 26. of October in the yere of our Lord God 1576. Taken word for word out of his last will and testament. Whereunto is added the Lantgraue his answere to the French King
Proclamations. 1620-07-01
titleStmt.author: Friedrich III, Elector Palatine, 1515-1576.
Johann Casimir, Pfalzgraf bei Rhein, 1543-1592.
Wilhelm IV, Landgrave of Hesse, 1532-1592.

notesStmt.note: With a preface by John Casimir, Count Palatine, and a letter from William IV of Hesse Cassel to Henry III of France--STC.
"The answere of the most famous and excellent Prince William Lantgraue of Hessen" has caption title on E4v.
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University. Library.
